DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS Version 1.0 Adult Physical Health Domain Physical Function PFC37 Current Health Limits Climbing One Flight of Stairs Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how much their health now limits them in climbing one flight of stairs, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Physical Health Domain Physical Function Current Health Limits Climbing One Flight of Stairs Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses the status of an individual's physical health._The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess an individual's ability to carry out activities that require physical actions including more complex activities that require a combination of skills, often within a social context._A question about whether an individual's current health limits them in climbing one flight of stairs._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses the status of an individual's physical health.

The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess an individual's ability to carry out activities that require physical actions including more complex activities that require a combination of skills, often within a social context.

ValueDomain.preferredName: PROMIS Health Limitation Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used with the PROMIS items that describes a range of subjective scores for representing how much an individual is limited from doing a specific activity because of their health from 1: Cannot do, to 5: Not at all.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual cannot do something.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual cannot do something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something for the smallest amount of effort or duration of time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something for the smallest amount of effort or duration of time.
A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does your health now limit you in climbing one flight of stairs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are available from the PROMIS Assessment Center.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
